at0000.1.description: A framework to communicate information that has been captured and curated in anticipation of future need for care.

at0000.description: A framework to communicate information that has been captured and curated in anticipation of future need for care.

en.purpose: To record additional composition metadata aligned with IHE-XDS which is not already available from the Reference Model COMPOSITION class.
en.use: Use to add IHE-XDS aligned metadata to a COMPOSITION.context, which along with existing COMPOSITION attributes, allows the composition to be registered in an IHE-XDS environment.

includedExternalTerminologyCodes.value: Living will and advance directive record

at0000.description: Additional composition metadata aligned with IHE-XDS which is not already available from the Reference Model COMPOSITION class.

at0001.description: The speciality of the author/composer of the document.

at0002.description: A high-level document class code, normally selected from a valueset provided by the IHE-XDS Affinity Domain.
at0002.comment:
For example: Report, Summary, Images, Plan, Patient Preferences, Workflow.
These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.

at0003.description: The code specifying the precise type of document from the user perspective. Normally selected from a valueset provided by the local IHE-XDS Affinity Domain or national standard.
at0003.comment:
for example:  Pulmonary History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Ultrasound Report.
These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.

at0004.description: A term specifying the level of confidentiality of the XDS Document.
at0004.comment: Coded text is preferred, normally specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.

at0007.description: A term defining the healthcare facility type.
at0007.comment: Coded text is preferred. The codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.

at0009.description: The code specifying the clinical specialty where the act that resulted in the document was performed.
at0009.comment:
For example: Family Practice, Laboratory, Radiology.
Coded text is preferred, normally specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.

at0010.description: Additional metadata about the document itself, including size, url.

at0011.description: This list of codes represents the main clinical acts.

at0000.1.description: A multimedia resource that is generated or acquired during the provision of healthcare.

at0002.1.description: Name or title of the multimedia resource.

at0000.description: A multimedia resource that is generated or acquired during the provision of healthcare.

at0001.comment: The actual content will be captured and stored using the Multimedia data type. For example: RTF or PDF for a document; JPG for an image; MP4 for a video; or WAV for an audio file. If the content is stored elsewhere the external location can be referenced using the URI data type.

at0002.description: Name or title of the multimedia resource.

at0004.description: The time, date, partial date or period when the resource was generated or authored.

at0007.description: Additional narrative about the multimedia source not captured in other fields.

at0011.description: Details about the device used to generate or author the resource.
at0011.comment: For example: the camera used to capture an image.

at0012.description: Details about the individual or organisation who generated or authored the resource.

at0013.description: Further details about the multimedia source.

at0013.1.description: Further details about the multimedia source.

at0000.1.description: A framework to communicate the preferences of an individual for future medical treatment and care.

at0004.1.description: The status of the advance care directive.
at0004.1.comment: Coding of the advance care directive status with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

at0006.1.text: Advance Decision to Refuse Treatment details
at0006.1.description: Narrative description of the overall advance care directive.
at0006.1.comment: May be used to record a narrative overview of the complete advance care directive, which may or may not be supported by structured data. Details of specific structured findings can be included using CLUSTER archetypes in the 'Directive details' slot. This data element may be used to capture legacy data that is not available in a structured format.

at0000.description: A framework to communicate the preferences of an individual for future medical treatment and care.

at0004.description: The status of the advance care directive.
at0004.comment: Coding of the advance care directive status with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

at0005.description: The type of advance care directive.
at0005.comment:
A short text description of the nature of the advance care directive. Coding of the type of directive with a terminology is preferred, where possible. It is expected that this is largely localised to reflect local policy and legislation.

For example, in the Netherlands, advance care directive types include, but are not limited to, 'Treatment prohibition', 'Treatment prohibition with completion of Completed Life', 'Euthanasia request' and 'Declaration of life'.

In the UK, advance care directive types include 'Advance Decision', 'Advance Directive' and 'Advance Statement'.

at0006.description: Narrative description of the overall advance care directive.
at0006.comment: May be used to record a narrative overview of the complete advance care directive, which may or may not be supported by structured data. Details of specific structured findings can be included using CLUSTER archetypes in the 'Directive details' slot. This data element may be used to capture legacy data that is not available in a structured format.

at0007.description: The conditions or situations in which the individual wishes the advance care directive to apply.
at0007.comment:
For example: dementia, brain injury, diseases of the central nervous system, and terminal illness. Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

The advance care directive applies to all specified conditions if the individual can no longer make or communicate decisions about their medical treatment and is unlikely to regain the ability to make such decisions. Details of specific decisions that apply to different conditions or situations can be included using CLUSTER archetypes in the 'Directive details' slot.

at0025.description: Personal details of a person who witnesses the completion of the advance care directive.

at0027.description: Description of any legislation or other authoritative guidance that apply.
at0027.comment:
For example, 'In England and Wales, advance decisions are covered by the Mental Capacity Act.  Mandate: https://www.bma.org.uk/advice/employment/ethics/consent/consent-tool-kit/9-advance-decisions'. 

Or 'Jehovah's Witnesses believe that the Bible prohibits Christians from accepting blood transfusions. Mandate: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jehovah%27s_Witnesses_and_blood_transfusions'.

at0030.description: Information regarding where the advance care directive is stored and how to gain access to it.
at0030.comment: For example, 'In the top drawer of the bedside table'.

at0038.description: Additional narrative about the advance care directive not captured in other fields.

at0044.description: The individual has an advance care directive.

at0045.description: The individual does not have an advance care directive.

at0047.description: It is not known whether the individual has an advance care directive.

at0052.description: Structured details about the advance care directive decisions.
at0052.comment: This SLOT should also be used to record details for specific conditions or as per national or other local requirements. For example, in the UK, there may be a specific statement about whether to actively prolong life but only during pregnancy.

at0053.description: The date/time that marks the beginning of the valid period of time for this advance care directive.

at0054.description: The date/time that marks the conclusion of the valid period of time for this advance care directive.
at0054.comment: 'Valid period end' may often overlap with 'Review due date'. However, they may need to be recorded separately in circumstances where a document has an extended period of validity but requires an interim review. That may be due to changed personal circumstances/events or local policy.

at0055.description: The date when this advance directive record was last updated.
at0055.comment: This may not be a formal review but e.g. a typo correction.

at0056.description: The date at which the advance care directive is due to be reviewed.
at0056.comment: 'Valid period end' may often overlap with 'Review due date'. However, they may need to be recorded separately in circumstances where a document has an extended period of validity but requires an interim review. That may be due to changed personal circumstances/events or local policy.

at0058.description: Information regarding where the advance care directive is stored and who has a copy of it.

at0059.description: Details of a person who has a copy of the advance care directive.

at0060.description: Digital document, image or video representing the advance care directive.

at0061.description: Additional information required to extend the model with local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
at0061.comment: For example: local information requirements; or additional metadata to align with FHIR.

at0038.1.description: Additional narrative about the advance care directive not captured in other fields.

at0027.1.description: Description of any legislation or other authoritative guidance that apply.
at0027.1.comment:
For example, 'In England and Wales, advance decisions are covered by the Mental Capacity Act.  Mandate: https://www.bma.org.uk/advice/employment/ethics/consent/consent-tool-kit/9-advance-decisions'. 

Or 'Jehovah's Witnesses believe that the Bible prohibits Christians from accepting blood transfusions. Mandate: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jehovah%27s_Witnesses_and_blood_transfusions'.

For example, in the Netherlands, advance care directive types include, but are not limited to, 'Treatment prohibition', 'Treatment prohibition with completion of Completed Life', 'Euthanasia request' and 'Declaration of life'.

In the UK, advance care directive types include 'Advance Decision', 'Advance Directive' and 'Advance Statement'.

However, they may need to be recorded separately in circumstances where a document has an extended period of validity but requires an interim review. at0000.1.description: Et rammeverk for Ã¥ kommunisere et individs viljeserklÃ¦ring i forbindelse med fremtidig medisinsk behandling og omsorg.

at0000.description: Et rammeverk for Ã¥ kommunisere et individs viljeserklÃ¦ring i forbindelse med fremtidig medisinsk behandling og omsorg.

at0004.comment: Dersom det er mulig er det foretrukket Ã¥ kode det fremtidige behandlingsvalgets status med en terminologi.

at0005.comment:
En kort fritekstlig beskrivelse av hvilken type dokument for fremtidig behandlingsvalg det er. Dersom det er mulig, anbefales Ã¥ kode typen dokument med en terminologi. Det er antatt at dette i stor grad blir tilpasset lokale retningslinjer og lovgivning.

"Mitt livstestament" er en norsk variant. I andre land er det flere typer fremtidige behandlingsvalg, for eksempel finnes det i Nederland fremtidig behandlingsvalg som omfatter "Treatment prohibition" (AvstÃ¥ fra behandling), "'Treatment prohibition with completion of Completed Life" (AvstÃ¥ fra livsforlengende behandling) og "Euthanasia request" (Ãnske om eutanasi).

at0006.comment: Kan bli brukt til et sammendrag av, eller fullstendig tekst i det fremtidige behandlingsvalget. Dette kan eventuelt vÃ¦re i tillegg til strukturerte data, eller stÃ¥ for seg selv. Detaljer om spesifikke Ã¸nsker kan bli inkludert ved Ã¥ nÃ¸ste CLUSTER-arketyper i SLOT'et "Strukturerte detaljer". Dette informasjonselementet kan ogsÃ¥ bli brukt for Ã¥ lagre data fra et annet system som ikke er tilgjengelig som strukturerte data.

at0007.description: Situasjoner eller tilstander hvor individet Ã¸nsker at det fremtidige behandlingsvalget skal tre i kraft.
at0007.comment:
For eksempel: Demens, hjerneskade, sykdommer i sentralnervesystemet og terminal sykdom. Dersom det er mulig er det foretrukket Ã¥ kode dette med en terminologi.

Det fremtidige behandlingsvalget gjÃ¸res gjeldende for alle tilstander eller situasjoner som nevnes, dersom individet ikke lenger kan formidle beslutninger om sin medisinske behandling, og det er usannsynlig at individet kan fÃ¥ tilbake evnen til Ã¥ ta slike beslutninger. Dersom det er nÃ¸dvendig med detaljerte betingelser, for eksempel om enkelte typer behandling kombinert med en gitt tilstand, kan dette dokumenteres ved Ã¥ nÃ¸ste CLUSTER-arketyper i SLOT'et "Detaljerte behandlingsvalg".

at0025.description: Detaljer om personer som har vÃ¦rt vitne ved ferdigstillelsen (signering) av det fremtidige behandlingsvalget.

at0027.description: Beskrivelse av hvilken lovgivning eller annen autorativ retningslinje som gjelder for det fremtidige behandlingsvalget.
at0027.comment: For eksempel "Lov om pasient- og brukerrettigheter (pasient- og brukerrettighetsloven) Â§ 4-9. Pasientens rett til Ã¥ nekte helsehjelp i sÃ¦rlige situasjoner" eller Jehovas Vitners avvisning av blodtransfusjon: "https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jehovas_vitner#Avvisning_av_blodtransfusjoner".

at0030.description: Informasjon om hvor det fremtidige behandlingsvalget er lagret, og hvordan man kan fÃ¥ tak i det.
at0030.comment: For eksempel "I Ã¸verste skuff i nattbordet".

at0038.description: Ytterligere fritekst om det fremtidige behandlingsvalget, som ikke er omfattet av andre elementer.

at0044.description: Individet har dokumentert en viljeserklÃ¦ring for fremtidig behandling.

at0045.description: Individet har ikke dokumentert en viljeserklÃ¦ring for fremtidig behandling.

at0047.description: Det er ikke kjent om individet har dokumentert en viljeserklÃ¦ring for fremtidig behandling eller ikke.

at0052.description: Strukturerte detaljer om det fremtidige behandlingsvalget.
at0052.comment: Dette SLOT'et kan ogsÃ¥ bli brukt til Ã¥ registrere spesielle betingelser i henhold til nasjonale eller lokale krav. For eksempel kan det i Storbritannia vÃ¦re et eget utsagn om individet aktivt Ã¸nsker Ã¥ motta livsforlengende behandling, men bare hvis individet er gravid.

at0053.description: Dato/Tid som markerer nÃ¥r gyldighetsperioden av det fremtidige behandlingsvalget starter.

at0054.description: Dato/Tid som markerer nÃ¥r gyldighetsperioden av det fremtidige behandlingsvalget slutter.
at0054.comment: "Gyldighetsperiode slutt" vil ofte overlappe med "Dato for fornyelse". Det kan imidlertid vÃ¦re nÃ¸dvendig Ã¥ registrere disse separat i tilfelle et fremtidig behandlingsvalg har en forlenget gyldighetsperiode, men trenger en midlertidig gjennomgang. Dette kan skyldes endringer i personlige forhold/hendelser eller lokale retningslinjer.

at0055.description: *The date when this advance directive record was last updated. (en)

Eine kurze schriftliche Beschreibung der Art der PatientenverfÃ¼gung. Eine Kodierung mit einer Terminologie wird, bevorzugt. Es wird erwartet, dass diese weitgehend lokalisiert ist, um die lokale Politik und Gesetzgebung widerzuspiegeln.

In den Niederlanden beispielsweise umfassen die Arten von PatientenverfÃ¼gungen unter anderem "Behandlungsverbot", " Behandlungsverbot mit Beendigung des abgeschlossenen Lebens", "Euthanasieantrag" und "LebenserklÃ¤rung".
